tourBios.exmtStatus: Exempt - Next 25 Money Winners from 2014 Web.com Tour Finals
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Played 17 Web.com Tour events, making 11 cuts. Had two top-10s and six top-25s. Finished the Regular Season 48th on the money list...Turned pro after attending Cal in the fall of 2013 and competing in the Web.com Tour Q-School in December...Made his pro debut at the PGA TOUR's Farmers Insurance Open in his hometown area of San Diego in January (missed cut)...Received an invitation from Jack Nicklaus to play in the Memorial Tournament the first week in June (missed cut)...His Qualifying School status resulted in limited access early in the season, thus his fourth Web.com Tour event did not come until the second week in June, at the Cleveland Open. A steady week (69-68-69-69) led to a T10, his first Tour top-10...Had a good run in July and August, recording four top-25s over a five-tournament swing, capped by a T2 at the Price Cutter Charity Championship. Fired a 20-under 268 that week to finish one back of champion Cameron Percy. Forfeited his chance at victory when he improperly picked up his ball in the rough on the 72nd hole, resulting in a one-shot penalty and a missed playoff opportunity...Had a respectable run in the Web.com Tour Finals, making the last three cuts and posting T27, T32 and T14 finishes...Finished 61st in the priority ranking, 11 spots behind the 50th and final card issued...Was 4th in Greens In Regulation (74.56).

2013: Played the Web.com Tour Qualifying Tournament as an amateur (was still enrolled at Cal and competing on the golf team). Opened strong with 68-69-66 before disappointing final three rounds of 70-74-75 to finish T56. Had the option to activate his membership at any time during the 2014 season, provided he declared his professional intentions. Two days after Q-School, he announced he had turned pro.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: In first two seasons at the University of California, was one of the nation's leading golfers in both the collegiate and amateur ranks...Was an Honorable Mention All-American his freshman year...As a sophomore in 2012-13, was Pac-12 Player of the Year, named first-team All-American and became Cal's first national Player of the Year in four different selection processes...Was named 2013 Jack Nicklaus Award winner as top collegiate player of the year...Won the Fred Haskins Award for college golf excellence the same year...Represented the U.S. on the Palmer Cup as well as the Walker Cup at The National GL...Was low amateur in the 2013 U.S. Open at Merion, being as high as T3 through 15 holes of the third round. Eventually finished T17...His Torrey Pines High School team won the state title his senior season and the Southern California crown his final three years in high school.
tourBios.personal: Attended Torrey Pines High School in San Diego, Calif...Moved to Houston, Texas, where he lives with his brother, in 2014...Earliest golf memory was hitting the driver for the first time...If not a golfer, would like to be an ESPN golf analyst...Favorite courses played are Riviera CC and The National GL...Favorite pro teams are the Los Angeles Lakers and San Diego Chargers...Favorite TV shows are "Modern Family" and "Suits."...Favorite movies are "Remember the Titans," "The Hangover" and "Talladega Nights."...Favorite entertainer is Imagine Dragons...Favorite book is Angels and Demons by Dan Brown...Favorite athletes are Kobe Bryant, Michael Jordan and Aaron Rodgers...Favorite cities are New York and Rome...First-tee introduction song would be "We Are the Champions" by Queen...Bucket list includes playing in the Masters, playing a round with Tiger Woods and attending the NBA Finals or the Super Bowl...Would like to trade places with Woods for a day ("He is the very best!")...Twitter name is @mike_kim714.

tourBios.carHigh:
2015: Finished the Web.com Tour season with 24 starts, two third-place finishes, five top-10s, eight top-25s and 19 cuts made. Led the Tour in the All-Around Ranking. Was 35th in the final priority-ranking order...Survived the cut in eight of his first 10 starts...Earned first top 10 at the Greater Dallas Open in early June. After a 67-64 start, climbed within three of the lead after third-round 69. Struggled much of the final round but closed his day with two birdies for a T8...Added momentum the following week, recording a T3 at the Rust-Oleum Championship in Ohio to get to No. 19 on the money list. Was three shots back after 36 holes, with rounds of 68-66, and two back after a Saturday 66. On Sunday, birdies on Nos. 16 and 17 led to a final-round 68 and a T2, his first top-five performance on Tour since a T2 at the 2014 Price Cutter Charity Championship...Recorded another top-five finish just two weeks later, at the Albertsons Boise Open. Fired a bogey-free 63 in the final round that pushed him to a T5...After a missed cut at the Stonebrae Classic and a T41 at the Utah Championship, found himself outside the top 25 at No. 26...Closed the Regular Season making his last four cuts, which included a T3 at the Digital Ally Open and an 8th at the WinCo Foods Portland Open. The Digital Ally finish moved him up to No. 20 and the timely Portland performance wrapped up the 13th spot on the money list, which secured his PGA TOUR card for 2015-16...Led the Tour in the All-Around Ranking through the end of the Regular Season. Played all 21 Regular Season events...Made two of four cuts in the Finals, with a T29 at the Nationwide Children's Hospital Championship his best finish. Withdrew after the first round of the Web.com Tour Championship, citing flu-like systems. Finished No. 82 on the Web.com Tour Finals money list.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the PGA TOUR in 2016 is T16th at the Shriners Hospitals for Children Open.
dyn.dynStats: He ranks T76th in Driving Distance - Fairway Woo on the PGA TOUR.
